newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares end with trimmed gains.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares end with trimmed gains.

text.p: Shares on the Delhi bourse closed higher on buying by local mutual and foreign funds, but a bout of late profit-taking trimmed early gains, brokers said.
The Delhi sensitive index closed up 6.36 points at 669.14 after touching a day's high of 674.15.
"Huge short-covering at lower levels was the main reason for the rally in share prices," said Manoj Choraria of brokers Choraria Investments.
Reliance Industries rose 7.75 rupees to 185.25 while TISCO ended 2.25 rupees higher at 157.20.
ITC closed 0.30 rupee higher at 273. It had shot up to 289 rupees earlier in the day, mainly on the strength of buoyant six-month results announced on Monday.
ITC registered net profit of 1.81 billion rupees in the first six months of fiscal 1995/96 (April-March) against 1.41 billion last year.
State Bank of India firmed up 2.75 rupees to 218.95 and Oriental Bank of Commerce rose 4.70 rupees 72.75.
